intro: Sisymbrium acuticarpum, commonly known as the sharp-fruited mustard, is an annual flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard species. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom from late spring to early summer. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind.
